Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Target.com or Target blocked Israel from accessing and shopping their website. The only evidence provided is anecdotal accounts from a few individuals.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Target.com or Target intentionally blocked access from Israel without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the temporary outage, such as technical issues or server problems, which were reported by a local news source.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance of the temporary outage by presenting it as a minor issue that was quickly resolved. However, the frustration expressed by individuals who experienced the "Access Denied" message suggests that it may have had a greater impact.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting conflicting information. While some individuals reported being unable to access the website, others reported that it was accessible and fully operational.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Target.com was accessible and fully operational on December 7, 2016, according to Twitter users based in Israel.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of the issue by suggesting that Target blocked all Israeli computers from viewing their website, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
